Well, I wouldn't mind having a Frank's box, I  would be more then glad to 
=
buy one from him should he wish ever to make one for  me,  I would like it'=
s 
wood painted in an azure blue trim please with the  rest a natural shade=
 of 
Mahogany (if can be found) or aromatic cedar  (and I would be glad to =
supply 
the wood as, I have hundreds of  tress here. <s>sf
 
 
In a message=
 dated 5/29/2009 10:01:49 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
april@abercrombiegh=
ostresearch.com writes:

 
 


I think the bottom line is we all know  that=
 Chris Moon is probably just 
trying to use you. He'll suck you dry and  to=
ss you aside when he gets his 
fill.
 

----- Original Message ----- 
From:=
 _Fransen, Debbie_ (mailto:debbie.fransen@...)  
To: _EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com)  
Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 7:4=
5  AM
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Different chip  config.



Exactly my point...=
 You don't charge anything for the  boxes
and Chris Moon charges people for=
 using  it....
If it's not perfected then Chris shouldn't charge  either...=
...
If he wasn't so public with it, then people like me  wouldn't dislike h=
im 
so much.
 
The only people that have your boxes (that the public hear  =
about)
are the well known paranormal groups and famous  people.
I am sure t=
hat you have given boxes to researchers who are  not in the 
popular
parano=
rmal community ,and don't want to be. Those are the  ones that should
get r=
espect.  And of course YOU are well respected by  us lowly 
researchers. ( =
Kissin up , so you won't get  mad)
 
And I am sure that you are sick of hea=
ring about Chris  Moon and how
alot of people thinks he sucks. And everyone=
 wants a  box......
But you have to expect that. You are the only one out  =
there that is honest 
and
doesn't want to be famous.
I know this is like be=
ating a dead horse, so I will shut  up now.... :)
 
 

 
__________________=
__________________
 From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups EVP-ITC@yahoogroups<WB EVP-IT=
C@yahoogr EVP-On

Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 9:22=
 AM

g.

ge for 
the boxes. Someday I will--when it's perfected!
 
 Frank-S

aks highly of him.

 That would be even b=
etter.  Where are you from?   Chris Moon speaks highly 
of you.

ubject: Re: [EVP-ITC]  Different chip config.


Besides--I didn't like that=
 radio design, it's too complex, and the  
documentation is screwy. I did a=
 simpler radio last night that should be  better, 
simpler, cheaper, and cl=
earer sound.

3@ yahoo.com_ 
(mailto:cozykat2003@...) > wrote:


 
 



The jpg for=
 this schematic is kind of blurry in places.  Is  there any way 
a more cle=
ar copy could be send to me? I would be forever  grateful.  Thanks 
Frank -=
 Elaine

 From: Frank Sumption  <=

To: _EV=

ay 28, 2009  12:55:00 AM
Subject:  Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.


_=
http://purplealieng irl.tripod. com/_ (http://purplealiengirl.tripod.com/) =

 
 

However, it's constantly changing. The radio I made tonight  is very =

simple, and can significantly simplify construction. I used to  make the s=
weep and 
amplifier circuits, then use a commercial radio, like  the 12-469=
, as a 
tuner. 
 
 The MK484 is follwed by a couple high impedence op amp s=
tages  to bring 
the audio up to line levels. I haven't had time to do sche=
matic  yet. I draw 
the schematics with MS paint, and they are stored as jp=
eg  images, which 
isn't the best, but it makes them e-mailable. 
 
 Frank-=
S




On Wed, May 27, 2009 at 8:54 PM, Elaine Coates <_cozykat2003@ yahoo.c=
om_ 
(mailto:cozykat2003@...) >  wrote:



 
 



 
Hi folks, I just =
joined this group.  I was recently at the  Lizzy Borden 
house in Massachus=
etts with Chris Moon and had a session  with Frank's Box.  
The results wer=
e astounding.  Is this the  newest schematic for Frank's box?  
If so, is t=
here a way to get a  clearer copy of it?  My son said he would 
build one f=
or me and I  have been searching for the schematic.  Can anyone 
help? -  E=
laine




  
____________________________________
 From: Frank Sumption  <_=
purplealiengirl@ gmail.com_ 
(mailto:purplealiengirl@...) >

To: _evp=
-itc@yahoogroups .com_ (mailto:evp-itc@yahoogroups.com) ; 
_grassharp@yahoo=
grou ps.com_ (mailto:grassharp@yahoogroups.com)   

Sent:  Wednesday, May 2=
7, 2009 5:45:16 PM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Different chip  config. [1 Attachment=
]




I think I followed an erroneous LM3820 layout, so I'm going  to bread=
board 
this layout. Note the antenna input is now on pin 12-11,  this is th=
e RF amp 
input, and pin 13 is the RF amp output, which feeds  pin 1.
 
 'c=
ase anyone cares. 
 
 F-S
